title: Giuliani urged Trump to eject exiled Turkish cleric from US: report
text:
President Trump Donald John TrumpBusiness school deans call for lifting country-specific visa caps Bolton told ex-Trump aide to call White House lawyers about Ukraine pressure campaign: report Federal prosecutors in New York examining Giuliani business dealings with Ukraine: report MORE's personal attorney Rudy Giuliani Rudy GiulianiBolton told ex-Trump aide to call White House lawyers about Ukraine pressure campaign: report Federal prosecutors in New York examining Giuliani business dealings with Ukraine: report Ex-Trump aide on Russia testifies for 10 hours as part of impeachment inquiry MORE urged the president in 2017 to eject an exiled Turkish cleric from the U.S., The Washington Post reported Tuesday night.

Giuliani, who was not the president's attorney at the time, told Trump that the U.S. should remove Fethullah Gulen from the country, former officials told the Post.

Turkey has requested Gulen be turned over to its custody to face trial for allegedly plotting a coup against Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

DEVELOPING
description: President Trump's personal attorney Rudy Giuliani urged the president in 2017 to eject an exiled Turkish cleric from the U.S., The Washington Post
